newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: MidEast firms to win Pakistan oil products tender.
newsitem.headline: MidEast firms to win Pakistan oil products tender.

text.p: The lowest offers in Pakistan's tender to buy gas oil (diesel), fuel oil and gasoline for October-December delivery were made by two MidEast oil trading firms, traders said on Monday.
The tender sought two cargoes of 60,000 tonnes each of 1.0 percent sulphur gas oil for delivery each month.
Traders said Jeddah-based Bakri Bunkers' offer at a premium of $1.388 per barrel to MidEast spot quotes on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Keamari was most competitive.
Bakri Bunkers also made the lowest offer for the 100,000 tonnes of 3.5-percent sulphur, 180-cst fuel oil sought by the tender.
The offer was at a premium of $8.88 per tonne to MidEast quote, c-and-f Fotco.

Bakri offered 3.5-percent sulphur, 125-centistoke grade fuel oil delivered in Noveber and December, c-and-f Fotco, based on a formula of 95 percent for the 180-centistoke grade and five percent for the gas oil formula.
The price was $8.88 per tonne over MidEast fuel oil quotes and 99 cents per barrel over MidEast gas oil quotes.
Pakistan sought 100,000 tonnes of 125-grade fuel oil for delivery in November and December. This grade is normally used by power stations during winter.
Star Energy offered the lowest price for 80-octane leaded gasoline at $17.45 per tonne above MidEast naphtha quotes, c-and-f Keamari.
The tender sought one 25,000-tonne cargo each month, but the November cargo was optional.
